content.raw: You are getting the next element first. Does that skip over the first compositor, or is `it` before the beginning of the compositor list when `getCompositors()` is called?
content.html: You are getting the next element first. Does that skip over the first compositor, or is it before the beginning of the compositor list when getCompositors() is called?

pullrequest.title: Add Screen Space Ambient Occlusion visual plugin

content.raw: it's a little confusing but the ogre iterator's `getNext` function returns the current element first then advances the iterator.  Here's an [example usage](https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/dd30349ea6670e3cd962d9d41a8039de3a3482d3/OgreMain/src/OgreCompositorManager.cpp?at=v1-9-0&fileviewer=file-view-default#OgreCompositorManager.cpp-214) in their source code
content.html: it's a little confusing but the ogre iterator's getNext function returns the current element first then advances the iterator. Here's an example usage in their source code

content.raw:
It looks like SSAO is enabled on interaction visuals, such as the translate and rotate arrows. Can SSAO be disabled for thos visuals?

Same is true for laser visuals, and probably others.
content.html:
It looks like SSAO is enabled on interaction visuals, such as the translate and rotate arrows. Can SSAO be disabled for thos visuals?

Same is true for laser visuals, and probably others.

pullrequest.title: Add Screen Space Ambient Occlusion visual plugin

content.raw: Just curious, why only these two strings are kept in member variables while others like `SSAO/Post/Modulate` and `SSAO/GBuffer` aren't?
content.html: Just curious, why only these two strings are kept in member variables while others like SSAO/Post/Modulate and SSAO/GBuffer aren't?

pullrequest.title: Add Screen Space Ambient Occlusion visual plugin

content.raw: There are other SSAO techniques in OGRE but they all require the `Modulate` and `GBuffer` compositors so I hard coded them. I had the idea that in the future we could integrate more SSAO techniques and let the users change these two params to select the effects they want.
content.html: There are other SSAO techniques in OGRE but they all require the Modulate and GBuffer compositors so I hard coded them. I had the idea that in the future we could integrate more SSAO techniques and let the users change these two params to select the effects they want.
